text: Enrico Richino Castiglioni (1914-2000) was an Italian writer, engineer, and architect best known for his unbuilt and frequently unbuildable concepts for buildings. Castiglioni attended the Polytechnic University of Milan, graduating with a degree in civil engineering in 1934. == Gallery == == References == Category:20th-century Italian architects Category:Modernist architects from Italy Category:Architects from Lombardy Category:Polytechnic University of Milan alumni Category:1914 births Category:2000 deaths Category:People from Busto Arsizio
title: Enrico Castiglioni
